user_message: How can I build strength in my upper arms and shoulders?
raw_extraction:

### End of system information ###

To build strength in your upper arms and shoulders, I recommend the following exercises:

**Barbell Standing Wide Military Press**: This exercise targets your deltoids, which are the muscles in your shoulders responsible for shoulder movements. To perform this exercise, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Press the barbell straight up over your head, extending your arms fully, and then lower it back down to the starting position.

**Dumbbell Standing Biceps Curl**: This exercise targets your biceps, which are the muscles in your upper arms responsible for elbow flexion. To perform this exercise, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still, and then lower them back down to the starting position.

**Dumbbell Standing Kickback**: This exercise targets your triceps, which are the muscles in your upper arms responsible for elbow extension. To perform this exercise, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended behind you. Keeping your upper arm still, lift the dumbbell up and back, extending your elbow, and then lower it back down to the starting position.

These exercises will help you build strength in your upper arms and shoulders. Remember to start with lighter weights and gradually increase the weight as you become stronger.
